chapter_title: Severity

report_title: Rewterz Threat Alert Stonefly Group Continues To Hit High-Value Targets Active IOCs
chapter_title: Analysis Summary
text: Stonefly aka DarkSeoul, BlackMine, Operation Troy, and Silent Chollima, is a cyberespionage group that originally made headlines in July 2009, when it launched DDoS attacks on a variety of South Korean, government, and financial websites. However, in recent years, they have reduced their attention to exclusively espionage operations against high-value targets.

report_title: Rewterz Threat Alert Stonefly Group Continues To Hit High-Value Targets Active IOCs
chapter_title: Analysis Summary
text: Stoneflys operations appear to be part of a larger North Korean-sponsored campaign to obtain information and intellectual property, with another North Korean group, Pompilus, conducting a bigger trawl across numerous sectors. A most recent attack discovered by security researchers was against an engineering firm that works in the energy and military sectors. The attackers breached the organization most likely by exploiting the Log4j vulnerability (CVE-2021-44228) on a public-facing server. The attackers then compromised 18 other computers.

report_title: Rewterz Threat Alert Stonefly Group Continues To Hit High-Value Targets Active IOCs
chapter_title: Analysis Summary
text: Stoneflys tools and techniques are still evolving and due to its capabilities and emphasis on gathering sensitive data, the group is one of the most potent North Korean cyber threat actors active today.

report_title: Rewterz Threat Alert Stonefly Group Continues To Hit High-Value Targets Active IOCs
chapter_title: Impact
text: Information theft and espionage Exposure of sensitive data

report_title: Rewterz Threat Alert Stonefly Group Continues To Hit High-Value Targets Active IOCs
chapter_title: Remediation
text: Exercise caution when receiving messages from unknown senders. Block all threat indicators at your respective controls. Keep your software updated to the latest patches. Search for IOCs in your environment.
